description: Dive into "Discover Aix-en-Provence's Hidden Gems" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Discover Aix-en-Provence's Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: Nestled just a short stroll from the heart of Aix-en-Provence, the Promenade de la Torse is a serene green oasis that beckons both locals and visitors alike. This picturesque riverside park features a delightful mix of paved paths and hard-packed gravel trails, perfect for leisurely walks or invigorating runs along its 2.5 km loop.

sources.snippet: The park is a few minutes walk out of town, running along the river Torse. Many of the local yoga groups practise here and itâ€™s full of joggers and picnickers. If you walk via the Yves Blanc Sports Centre, you can practice football or basketball or use the running track for free.
sources.shortName: Top Free Things To Do In Aix-en-Provence

sources.snippet: Parc de la Torse was located right behind the apartment we stayed in on the east end of Aix, so we used it a lot. The long promenade follows a small stream with footbridges to cross. There are two small playgrounds, large grassy areas, a physical fitness course, ponds, and a futbal (soccer) field.
sources.shortName: Awesome Things To Do in Aix-en-Provence with Kids

places.name: Promenade de la Torse

reviews.text: Loved the views, we got here fortunately before the crowds. Such beauty!!!

Nice park for hanging out and picnic in Aix en Provence. It has a small lake with fishes for the kids, a grassy hill with trees for shadows and plenty other places to carry out different activities including jogging, pÃ©tanque, football, open gym, play area, etc. A small water stream gives this park an additional beauty and calmness.

It is located in eastern side of Aix near the piscine. Ample parking space is available near the piscine and it's a two minutes walk from there.

There are dedicated picnic spots with garden tables and kids play area. However, picnic on the grassy hill is allowed.

This park is quite a places to rest, do yoga or sports training or any outdoor activities.

Enjoy the family time on weekends ðŸ˜Š
Nice place to go whit your kids, multi parking but full

places.address: 12 Rue Pierre de Coubertin, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: The Fontaine de la Rotonde is a remarkable fountain in Aix-en-Provence, built in 1860 and featuring a rotunda shape topped with three statues representing justice, agriculture, and art. This elegant fountain stands out with its perfectly sculpted statues and captivating design, making it an unmissable sight as you wander through the charming streets of the city. It has become an iconic feature of local life and is surrounded by bustling markets that add to its vibrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: Built in 1860 as the centrepiece to the place de la Rotonde, the roundabout at the western edge of Cours Mireabeau, this magnificent fountain is adornedâ€¦

Alongside a lively local, you'll wander through the Roman destination, stumbling upon attractions, such as the Fontaine de la Rotonde, which was built during the 19th century and features a myriad of sculptures, including 12 lions, as well as swans, and angels astride dolphins. You'll also notice sculptures of three women on top of the fountain, which represent justice, agriculture and fine arts.
sources.shortName: Free Walking Tours in Aix-en-Provence - Compare & Book

sources.snippet: Most guestsâ€™ introduction to Aix, especially backpackers arriving by bus, is the impressive Fontaine de la Rotonde and walking along the iconic Cours Mirabeau, the cityâ€™s grand boulevard. This lively avenue is the cityâ€™s beating heart, where locals and visitors gather to sip coffee, people-watch, grab a bite to eat, and shop â€™til they drop.
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in Aix-en-Provence: Top Attractions & Hidden Gems

sources.snippet: The Rotunda at Place du GÃ©nÃ©ral de Gaulle reflects the past and future of Aixâ€™s development. The square was built between 1840 and 1850 and has a diameter of 100 meters. Then, in 1860, a fountain was added in the middle according to plans by the engineers Tournadre and Sylvestre.

places.name: Fontaine de la Rotonde

reviews.text: La Rotonde fountain. Beautiful place to visit if you're im Aix en Provence. Lots of restaurants, bars, pubs, shops, boutiques, churches to visit and most importantly accessible by train, TER, bus. Cabs, ubers also available. On a regular weekday most bars  open til 12AM but weekends are a different story. Lots of fun with friends and/or family.

Nice area to walk around. Many beautiful and cozy cafes.
Open markets during some of the week days and weekends.
great vibe and armosphere, the restaurants around the circle have an amazing scenery. One of the trees is home to beautiful green parrots which is pretty crazy.

places.address: Place du GÃ©nÃ©ral de Gaulle, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: Field of the Painters, located near Mount Saint Victoire, served as a muse for Paul Cezanne's masterpieces. Local artists often gather here to capture the stunning scenery on canvas. The park also offers an ideal setting for leisurely walks and picnics. Visitors can find 9 reproductions of Cezanne's works near his studio, showcasing his fascination with the mountain.
places.name: Field of the Painters

reviews.text: Well, you or your wife has to be into painting... big time. There's lots of great paintings from that view. If that's u, go. Go now. Have a good day.

not too long walk from the studio - but you can take the bus. Its kind of park with medeteranian plants and nice view of the pinters mouintain from afar. There are also some reproductions of Cezanne mountain paintings so you can see the nature through the artist eyes

Wonderful Greenspan filled with local herbs and flowering bushes. Culminating at the top with an excellent display of Cezanne paintings and one of his subjects, the gorgeous French countryside and stark mountain vista.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the southern part of Aix-en-Provence, Promenade de l'Arc is a delightful destination for both families and fitness enthusiasts. This scenic area begins at Val de l'Arc park and meanders along the picturesque La Torse river, offering a serene running route that winds through lush greenery. As you jog or stroll, you'll encounter charming spots like Parc Jourdan and Parc Rambo, each with its own unique appeal.

sources.snippet: We visited the mid-sized, centrally located Parc Jourdan, the small neighborhood Parc Rambo, and the larger Promenade de lâ€™Arc which required a short drive. They each have a unique charm.
sources.siteName: No Bedtimes, No Borders: A Family Travel Blog

places.name: Promenade de l'Arc

reviews.text: Great place to take the kids for play freely during the day. Several equipment to amuse the little ones, tables to have a seat and ear something and surrounding nature to be in touch with.
3 kilometers of tranquility with majestic, old growth trees, and vibrant river.

A proper playground with adult exercise area, a playground for 2-8 year Olds, a playground for 8-12 year Olds and a flying fox. lots of tree cover with ample picnic tables. lots of rubbish bins around too. no toilet close by that I could see. parking lot is huge and very close to the play area. best play ground in Aix by far!

places.address: Av. de l'Arc de Meyran, 13100 Aix-en-Provence, France

places.generalDescription: Place des Quatre-Dauphins is a charming roundabout adorned with a striking obelisk fountain featuring four dolphins spouting water. This area is part of the Cours Mirabeau, where visitors can admire various landmarks such as the Fountain of 9 Cannons and Renaissance-style mansions like Hotel de Boisgelin and Hotel de Caumont.

sources.snippet: If you are a lover of fountains, this is the place to be â€“ fountains are among the most popular things to see in Aix-en-Provence. The fountain of four dolphins is much loved in Aix; itâ€™s one of the most photographed in town and where the local kids and dogs cool off in the summer.
sources.shortName: Top Free Things To Do In Aix-en-Provence

sources.snippet: It stands in a cozy square south of the Cours Mirabeau, which is conveniently called Place des Quatre Dauphins, hence, you donâ€™t get confused. To get there, turn onto Rue du 4 Septembre at Fontaine Moussue and youâ€™ll walk straight towards it. The fountain with the four dolphins, designed by Jean-Claude Rambot on what was previously the Place Mazarine in 1667, was so impressive that the square was renamed after it.
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in AIX-EN-PROVENCE in One Day

sources.snippet: Then cross Cours Mirabeau and head for Aix's old town, where inviting pedestrian streets hum with activity. Travelers who plan well enjoy the most vivid experience: Aix's farmers market is a classic ProvenÃ§al scene â€” rustic farmers selling fresh produce under the shade of graceful plane trees. Place Richelme hosts a lively market, as it has since the 1300s.
A three-minute walk from the HÃ´tel de Caumont is the Fontaine des Quatre Dauphins, one of the most iconic and charming fountains in Aix, known as the â€˜town of a thousand fountainsâ€™!
sources.shortName: Best Things to Do in Aix-en-Provence: Top Attractions & Hidden Gems

places.name: Place des Quatre-Dauphins

reviews.text: Its dry up, so only teo dolphins has water ðŸ¤£
One of several beautiful fountains in Aix-en-Provence

This is a small square containing a small obelisk on-top of a small fountain. The fountain's discharge points are sculptured dolphin heads, one on each side of the rectangular base. Unfortunately, vandals have broken one of the heads, which is currently held in place with some web-fabric tie-downs.

places.generalDescription: Place d'Albertas is a picturesque cobblestone square located in the heart of Aix-en-Provence. It features a charming fountain at its center and is surrounded by elegant buildings with noble frontages, sculpted gargoyles, and Roman tiles that have acquired a beautiful patina over time. The Mazarin quarter to the south boasts stunning mansion houses built during the reign of Louis XIV.

sources.snippet: The Albertas family built this square when they were bequeathed the huge adjacent house. They moved from Italy to take up residence. The son loved theatre and he built this square to put on performances, including some naughty phallic shapes in the detail of the balconies.
sources.shortName: Top Free Things To Do In Aix-en-Provence

places.name: Place d'Albertas

reviews.text: Interesting rustic, dated, run down, classic, and luxurious place which needs to be snapped by your caamera.
Beautiful spot in the city centre, one of the plenty squares in the city
